jpaccidents 0.1.5
  • Reference

Translate codes to human-readable labels using configuration data

translate_code.Rd

translate_code() translates codes to their corresponding human-readable labels based on the configuration data. It supports English and Japanese languages. If the code is not found in the configuration data, it will issue a warning and return NA.

Usage

translate_code(code, concept, lang = "en")

Arguments

code

A character vector of codes to be converted to labels.

concept

A string specifying the concept category (e.g., "impact_part")

lang

A string specifying the output language. Default is "en". Supported values are "en" (English) and "ja" (Japanese).

Value

A character vector of the same length as the input codes, containing the corresponding labels. Invalid codes are converted to NA with a warning.

Examples

# Convert a single code
translate_code("1", "impact_part")
#> [1] "front"

# Convert multiple codes
translate_code(c("1", "2"), "impact_part")
#> [1] "front" "right"

# Convert codes with Japanese labels
translate_code("1", "impact_part", "ja")
#> Error in translate_code("1", "impact_part", "ja"): unused argument ("ja")

# Handle invalid codes
translate_code(c("1", "999"), "impact_part")
#> ! In concept impact_part, The following code(s) is not registered: 999
#> [1] "front" NA
